Description: Handle-plate sherd of North Ionian pottery column-krater; underside reserved; edges glazed; cream slip on top; band of hook-meanders on rim; on handle plate, chain of linked concentric circles; pairs of solid tongues between. Fine, pinkish-light brown clay with a fair amount of small silver mica.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The same pattern on the plate British Museum 1965,0930.527. For parallels, see also Cambridge Museum of Classicad Archaeology NA15.
Bibliographic references: CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (II D, pl. IV, 24)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.308)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
